content:
TITLE: Basic React Native Material Button Example
DESCRIPTION: Simple example showing how to import and use a Button component from the React Native Material library. The button displays a title and shows an alert when pressed.
SOURCE: https://github.com/yamankatby/react-native-material/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
import React from "react";
import { Button } from "@react-native-material/core";

export default function App() {
  return <Button title="Button" onPress={() => alert("hi!")} />;
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing React Native Material Package
DESCRIPTION: Commands to install the @react-native-material/core package using either npm or yarn package managers.
SOURCE: https://github.com/yamankatby/react-native-material/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
npm install @react-native-material/core
```

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
yarn add @react-native-material/core
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Dependencies with Yarn
DESCRIPTION: Command to install required dependencies for each package in the project. Uses yarn as the preferred package manager.
SOURCE: https://github.com/yamankatby/react-native-material/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
yarn
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Unit Tests
DESCRIPTION: Command to run unit tests using Jest to verify code functionality.
SOURCE: https://github.com/yamankatby/react-native-material/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-23_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
yarn test
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running TypeScript Type Checking
DESCRIPTION: Command to verify code passes TypeScript type checking to ensure type safety.
SOURCE: https://github.com/yamankatby/react-native-material/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-23_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
yarn typescript
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running ESLint with Automatic Fixes
DESCRIPTION: Command to run ESLint with the --fix flag to automatically fix formatting errors when possible.
SOURCE: https://github.com/yamankatby/react-native-material/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-23_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
yarn lint --fix
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running ESLint
DESCRIPTION: Command to run ESLint to check for coding standard violations.
SOURCE: https://github.com/yamankatby/react-native-material/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-23_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
yarn lint
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Publishing to npm
DESCRIPTION: Command to publish new versions of the package to npm using release-it, which handles version bumping, tagging, and releases.
SOURCE: https://github.com/yamankatby/react-native-material/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-23_snippet_9

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
yarn release
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Starting the Example App Packager
DESCRIPTION: Command to start the Metro packager server for the example application for testing changes during development.
SOURCE: https://github.com/yamankatby/react-native-material/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
yarn example start
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Example App on Android
DESCRIPTION: Command to run the example application on an Android device or emulator to test changes.
SOURCE: https://github.com/yamankatby/react-native-material/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
yarn example android
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Example App on iOS
DESCRIPTION: Command to run the example application on an iOS device or simulator to test changes.
SOURCE: https://github.com/yamankatby/react-native-material/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
yarn example ios
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Example App on Web
DESCRIPTION: Command to run the example application in a web browser to test changes.
SOURCE: https://github.com/yamankatby/react-native-material/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-23_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
yarn example web
```
